test_scenarios.description: This scenario is to verify that all products have a valid category_id in the database
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Check if any product has an invalid or null category_id
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN 0 ELSE 1 END FROM products WHERE category_id IS NULL OR category_id NOT IN (SELECT category_id FROM categories)
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If the query returns 0, the test fails.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: SQL Query Testing for Product and Category Relationship
test_scenarios.description: This scenario is to test the SQL query that retrieves all products under a specific category
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Retrieve all products under a specific category and verify the correctness of the result
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END FROM products WHERE category_id = (SELECT category_id FROM categories WHERE category_name = 'Electronics')
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If the query returns 0, the test fails.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Data Integrity Check for Category ID
test_scenarios.description: This scenario is to ensure the integrity of data by checking that no two products have the same category_id
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Check if any two products have the same category_id
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN 0 ELSE 1 END FROM (SELECT category_id, COUNT(*) as cnt FROM products GROUP BY category_id) WHERE cnt > 1
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If the query returns 0, the test fails.
